member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntity`1.IsNew
member.summary: Returns true if this is a new object, false if it is a pre-existing object.
member.remarks: An object is considered to be new if its primary identifying (key) value doesn't correspond to data in the database. In other words, if the data values in this particular object have not yet been saved to the database the object is considered to be new. Likewise, if the object's data has been deleted from the database then the object is considered to be new.
member.returns: A value indicating if this object is new.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntity`1.MarkNew
member.summary: Marks the object as being a new object. This also marks the object as being dirty and ensures that it is not marked for deletion.
member.remarks: If you override this method, make sure to call the base implementation after executing your new code.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntity`1.MarkOld(A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntityIdentity)
member.summary: Marks the object as being an old (not new) object. This also marks the object as being unchanged (not dirty).

remarks.para: You should call this method in the implementation of DataPortal_Fetch to indicate that an existing object has been successfully retrieved from the database.
You should call this method in the implementation of DataPortal_Update to indicate that a new object has been successfully inserted into the database.
If you override this method, make sure to call the base implementation after executing your new code.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntityBase`1.MarkDeleted
member.summary: Marks an object for deletion. This also marks the object as being dirty.
member.remarks: You should call this method in your business logic in the case that you want to have the object deleted when it is saved to the database.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntityBase`1.MarkDirty
member.summary: Marks an object as being dirty, or changed.

remarks.para: You should call this method in your business logic any time the object's internal data changes.

Marking an object as dirty does two things. First it ensures that the object will be properly saved. Second, it causes to tell Windows Forms data binding that the object's data has changed so any bound controls will update to reflect the new values.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntityBase`1.MarkDirty(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marks an object as being dirty, or changed.
member.param: true to supress the PropertyChanged event that is otherwise raised to indicate that the object's state has changed.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntityBase`1.PropertyHasChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Performs processing required when a property has changed.
member.remarks: This method calls CheckRules(propertyName), MarkDirty and OnPropertyChanged(propertyName). MarkDirty is called such that no event is raised for IsDirty, so only the specific property changed event for the current property is raised.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntityBase`1.PropertiesHaveChanged(System.String[])
member.summary: Performs processing required when a range of properties have changed.
member.remarks: This method calls MarkDirty once, CheckRules(propertyName) for every property and OnPropertiesChanged(affectedProps) once for all affected properties. MarkDirty is called such that no event is raised for IsDirty, so only the specific property changed event for the current property is raised.

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.DomainEntityBase`1.CheckPropertyRules(System.String[])

member.param: The properties to check the rules for.

member.summary: Check object rules and notifies UI of properties that may have changed.

member.name: T:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntity
member.summary: This is the core interface implemented by all domain entity classes. Domain entity must have some unique identity value (primary key) that uniquely identifies an entity within the application database graph or indicates that the entity is new, not yet added to the application database graph.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntity.Id
member.summary: Gets an identity object that uniquely identifies the domain entity instance within the application database graph or indicates that the entity is new, not yet added to the application database graph.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntity.IsNew
member.summary: Returns true if this is a new object, false if it is a pre-existing object.
member.remarks: An object is considered to be new if its primary identifying (key) value doesn't correspond to data in the database. In other words, if the data values in this particular object have not yet been saved to the database the object is considered to be new. Likewise, if the object's data has been deleted from the database then the object is considered to be new.
member.returns: A value indicating if this object is new.

member.name: T:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntityIdentity
member.summary: Represents domain entity instance's unique identity value within the domain entity graph.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntityIdentity.DomainEntityType
member.summary: Gets a type of the domain entity that is identified.

member.summary: Gets a type of the underlying identity field (primary key: int, long, string, guid etc.).

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntityIdentity.IdentityValue
member.summary: Gets a value of the underlying identity field (primary key: int, long, string, guid etc.).

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.IDomainEntityIdentity.IsNew
member.summary: Returns true if the domain entity identified is a new entity, false if it is a pre-existing entity.
member.remarks: An object is considered to be new if its primary identifying (key) value doesn't correspond to data in the database. In other words, if the data values in this particular object have not yet been saved to the database the object is considered to be new. Likewise, if the object's data has been deleted from the database then the object is considered to be new.
member.returns: A value indicating if the entity identified is new.

member.name: T:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState
member.summary: Defines the common properties required by objects that track their own state.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the object and its child objects are currently valid, false if the object or any of its child objects have broken rules or are otherwise invalid.

remarks.para: By default this property relies on the underling ValidationRules object to track whether any business rules are currently broken for this object.
You can override this property to provide more sophisticated implementations of the behavior.

member.returns: A value indicating if the object is currently valid.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsSelfValid
member.summary: Returns true if the object is currently valid, false if the object has broken rules or is otherwise invalid.

remarks.para: By default this property relies on the underling ValidationRules object to track whether any business rules are currently broken for this object.
You can override this property to provide more sophisticated implementations of the behavior.

member.returns: A value indicating if the object is currently valid.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.HasWarnings
member.summary: Returns true if the object and its child objects have warning level broken rules (that do not render entity invalid, yet it's sensible to ask user for confirmation), false if the object or any of its child objects have no warning level broken rules.

remarks.para: By default this property relies on the underling ValidationRules object to track whether any business rules are currently broken for this object.
You can override this property to provide more sophisticated implementations of the behavior.

member.returns: A value indicating if the object or its child objects have warning level broken rules

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.HasSelfWarnings
member.summary: Returns true if the object has warning level broken rules (that do not render entity invalid, yet it's sensible to ask user for confirmation), false if the object has no warning level broken rules.

remarks.para: By default this property relies on the underling ValidationRules object to track whether any business rules are currently broken for this object.
You can override this property to provide more sophisticated implementations of the behavior.

member.returns: A value indicating if the object has warning level broken rules

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsDirty
member.summary: Returns true if this object's data, or any of its fields or child objects data, has been changed.

remarks.para: When an object's data is changed, application note of that change and considers the object to be 'dirty' or changed. This value is used to optimize data updates, since an unchanged object does not need to be updated into the database. All new objects are considered dirty. All objects marked for deletion are considered dirty.

Once an object's data has been saved to the database (inserted or updated) the dirty flag is cleared and the object is considered unchanged. Objects newly loaded from the database are also considered unchanged.

member.returns: A value indicating if this object's data has been changed.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsSelfDirty
member.summary: Returns true if this object's data has been changed.

remarks.para: When an object's data is changed, application makes note of that change and considers the object to be 'dirty' or changed. This value is used to optimize data updates, since an unchanged object does not need to be updated into the database. All new objects are considered dirty. All objects marked for deletion are considered dirty.

Once an object's data has been saved to the database (inserted or updated) the dirty flag is cleared and the object is considered unchanged. Objects newly loaded from the database are also considered unchanged.

member.returns: A value indicating if this object's data has been changed.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.ContainsNewData
member.summary: Returns true if this object's data, or any of its child objects data, has been changed.
member.remarks: In contrast to IsDirty tracks data changes for both new and old entities, i.e. new entity is always considered dirty, yet no data has been changed.
member.returns: A value indicating if this object's or any of its child objects data has been changed.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.SelfContainsNewData
member.summary: Returns true if this object's data has been changed.
member.remarks: In contrast to IsDirty tracks data changes for both new and old entities, i.e. new entity is always considered dirty, yet no data has been changed.
member.returns: A value indicating if this object's data has been changed.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsDeleted
member.summary: Returns true if this object is marked for deletion.
member.remarks: Application supports both immediate and deferred deletion of objects. This property is part of the support for deferred deletion, where an object can be marked for deletion, but isn't actually deleted until the object is saved to the database. This property indicates whether or not the current object has been marked for deletion. If it is true , the object will be deleted when it is saved to the database, otherwise it will be inserted or updated by the save operation.
member.returns: A value indicating if this object is marked for deletion.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsSavable
member.summary: Returns true if this object is both dirty and valid.
member.remarks: An object is considered dirty (changed) if returns true. It is considered valid if IsValid returns true. The IsSavable property is a combination of these two properties.
member.returns: A value indicating if this object is both dirty and valid.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ITrackState.IsChild
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child object, false if it is a root object.
member.remarks: An object should be marked as a child object unless it is the top most object (root object) in a domain object graph.
member.returns: A value indicating if this a child object.

member.name: T:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Metadata.DataAnnotations.ClassDescriptionAttribute
member.summary: Allows to decorate a class with localizable values that could be used for entity (edit) form captions, headers and menu items for create a new instance action as well as help uri for the respective help file/resource topic. Can use it as is by setting ResourceType value in the attribute decorator or inherit this class and set ResourceType in the constructor.
member.remarks: Inherited class is obviously a different entity, therefore this attribute can only be used either on concrete (final) business entity (class) or on business entity interface used for business metadata (that inherits ).

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Metadata.DataAnnotations.ClassDescriptionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for DisplayAttribute. All associated string properties and methods will return null.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Metadata.DataAnnotations.ClassDescriptionAttribute.NameForNew
member.summary:
Gets or sets the NameForNew attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized name for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: NameForNew is generally used as a caption or header for an UI form bound to the member bearing this attribute. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Metadata.DataAnnotations.ClassDescriptionAttribute.NameForOld
member.summary:
Gets or sets the NameForOld attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized description for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: NameForOld is generally used as a caption or header for an UI form bound to the member bearing this attribute. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Metadata.DataAnnotations.ClassDescriptionAttribute.NameForCreateNew
member.summary:
Gets or sets the NameForCreateNew attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized description for display.

member.summary: Values for validation rule severities.

member.name: F:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Rules.RuleSeverity.Error
member.summary: Represents a serious business rule violation that should cause an object to be considered invalid.

member.name: F:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Rules.RuleSeverity.Warning
member.summary: Represents a business rule violation that should be displayed to the user, yet should not make an object invalid.
member.remarks: Should cause dialog "Are you sure?"

member.name: F:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.Rules.RuleSeverity.Information
member.summary: Represents a business rule result that should be displayed to the user, but which is less severe than a warning.
member.remarks: Should NOT cause dialog "Are you sure?", only display field labels.

member.name: T:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceAttribute

member.name: M:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceAttribute.#ctor(A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Default constructor for ServiceAttribute.
member.param: a lifetime of the service within an IoC container

member.name: P:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceAttribute.Lifetime
member.summary: Gets a lifetime of the use case within a IoC container. Default is Transient.

member.name: T:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceLifetime
member.summary: Defines use case life time in a DI container.

member.name: F:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceLifetime.Transient
member.summary: created every time a use case is injected or requested

member.name: F:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceLifetime.Scoped
member.summary: Created per scope. In a web application, every web request creates a new separated service scope. That means scoped use cases are generally created per web request.

member.name: F:A5Soft.CARMA.Domain.ServiceLifetime.Singleton
member.summary: Created per DI container. That generally means that they are created only one time per application and then used for whole the application life time.
